snippet: With the possibility of a fifth Wimbledon title growing larger on the horizon, Serena Williams’s serve has made the difference, drawing gasps from the crowd and grim looks from opponents.
abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis asserts that Serena Williams' powerful serve is her greatest weapon; notes that Williams leads the Wimbledon in nearly all serving categories, winning 80 percent of her first-serve points and 63 percent of her second-serve points and winning 92 percent of her service games.
lead_paragraph: With the possibility of a fifth Wimbledon title growing larger on the horizon, Serena Williams’s serve has made the difference, drawing gasps from the crowd and grim looks from opponents.

headline.seo: Serena Williams’s Serve Makes the Difference at Wimbledon
headline.main: Williams Reaches for a Little Extra
headline.print_headline: Patience as Needed, But Always With Power
